column1: representative  of  the  British  Crown  in  Ceylon.  His  Lordship  the  Chief  Justice
“…the establishment and development of the Galle Face Green are firmly
engraved on a rock tablet and a plaque, found at the sea-ward edge and
at the Galle Road end, respectively of the Green… The rock tablet at the
sea-ward edge of the ‘walk’ marks the commencement of the Galle Face
Green  and  has  a  legal  significance,  that  we  have  to  take  note  of”…  The
rock tablet, well preserved up to date, has the following inscription –
